##### Zweite Analyse

```{r}

DIL_1 <- read.table('data/DIL_1.csv', header=TRUE, stringsAsFactors=FALSE, sep=";", dec=",", row.names="Dosisname")

summary(DIL_1)
str(DIL_1)


x <- (1:14)
y <- DIL_1$Mittelwert

y.sd <- DIL_1$sigma


var(DIL_1$Mittelwert)


```



## Including Plots
```{r, fig.width=10, fig.height=7, dev=c('png', 'pdf')}
plot(x, y, ylim=c(74, 80.2), xlab="Fraktion", family="serif", ylab="Dosis in Gray", family="serif", axes = FALSE, pch=16, cex=0.9, main="Dosisverteilung DIL Mittelwert 1", type="b")
text(x=13.4, y = 75.8, labels="Dosisvorgabe Boost", family="serif")> 
text(x=12.5, y = 80.2, labels="+5% Abweichung von Dosisvorgabe", family="serif")
axis(1, at=x, label=x, tick=F, family="serif")
arrows(x0=x, y0=y-y.sd, x1=x, y1=y+y.sd, code=3, angle=90, length=0.05)
abline(a=76,23, b=0, lty=2)
abline(a=80.04, b=0, lty=2)
axis(2, at=seq(74,81,0.5), tick=F, las=2, family="serif")
```


```{r}
par(bty="n") # keinen Rahmen

par(family="serif")
boxplot(DIL_1$Mittelwert, main="Boxplot DIL Mittelwert Patient 1", family="serif", ylab="Dosis in Gray", yaxt="n",  mgp=c(3,1,0)
        # mpg: Abstand Label zu Achse
        , cex.lab = 2, cex.axis=1.5, col="transparent")
axis(2, at=round(c(min(DIL_1$Mittelwert), mean(DIL_1$Mittelwert), max(DIL_1$Mittelwert)), 1), las = 2
     # las = 2 Ausrichtung Label-Beschriftung
     , xpd = TRUE, labels = T, cex.lab=2)



```
